delta:
I don’t have access to a time-checking tool in this chat, so I can’t read the current clock directly. I can:

- Tell you the current time if you tell me your city or time zone, or
- Give a quick command you can run on your device to get the exact time (examples below).

Commands you can run now:
- macOS / Linux terminal: date
- Windows PowerShell: Get-Date
- JavaScript (browser console): new Date().toString()
- Python: python -c "import datetime; print(datetime.datetime.now())"

Which option do you prefer (tell me your location/time zone or paste the output of one of the commands)?
